Package com.iontrading.mkv

Interface MkvLog

  • @Keep
@KeepPublicClassMemberNames
public interface MkvLog
    This is the interface of all log services exported or used by this API.

    This interface is intended to define a common set of operation which are either provided by log services exported by this API or required from user-defined adapters.

    Unless otherwise noted, passing a null argument to a constructor or method in this interface will cause a NullPointerException to be thrown.


    Normally, any call to log a new trace via add(String), add(int, String), add(String, Throwable) or add(int, String, Throwable) is non-blocking: the new trace will be appended into a memory buffer and the control is immediately returned to the application.
    A flusher thread asynchronously writes data onto the disk file, without interfering with application business logic and/or performance.


    In case the log memory buffer is temporarily full, the call might be blocking: the application will wait for the flusher thread to write the data onto disk and make enough room in the buffer to host the new trace.
    The application will temporarily block only when the following conditions hold:

    • The disk I/O throughput is greater or equal than a threshold
      The default threshold is 50 Mbyte/sec and it can be configured via mkv.adaptlog.mindiskthroughput
    • The wait is limited to a maximum timeout
      The default timeout is 5 seconds and it can be configured via mkv.adaptlog.maxsyncwait


    In all other cases, or when the timeout expires, the control is returned to the application and the trace is permanently lost.
    A specific message is traced into the log file to detect such condition, like the following example:


    Logging Suspended (Logging buffer full) - Detected I/O TPut: <Throughput>, SyncWaitTimeMsec: <BlockingTime>, SyncWaitThreadsSus: <SuspendedThreads>


    where:

    • <Throughput> is the detected disk I/O throughput, in bytes/sec
    • <BlockingTime> is the total amount of time the application has been waiting to add the new trace, in milliseconds
    • <SuspendedThreads> is the number of threads blocked during the wait, while attempting to log on the same file
    See Also:
    MkvLogManager, MkvQoS.setLog(MkvLog)
